title: Historical Price-to-Earnings (P/E) Ratio Trends of Collegium Pharmaceutical Inc Stock

content.text: The price-to-earnings (P/E) ratio is a commonly used valuation metric that compares a company's stock price to its earnings per share (EPS). It is an important indicator of market sentiment and investor expectations regarding a company's future profitability.
Below is a summary of Collegium Pharmaceutical Inc's historical P/E ratio data:
The analysis of Collegium Pharmaceutical Inc's historical P/E ratio trends can provide the following insights for investors:

By comparing the current P/E ratio with historical averages, investors can assess whether the stock is overvalued or undervalued. Higher P/E ratios indicate higher expectations for future earnings growth, while lower P/E ratios may suggest undervaluation.

P/E ratio trends can reflect the market's sentiment towards a company. Increasing P/E ratios may indicate positive market sentiment, while decreasing ratios may suggest a lack of confidence in the company's future earnings prospects.

Studying P/E ratio trends over multiple years can provide insights into a company's long-term performance. Consistently high or increasing P/E ratios may indicate sustained growth and profitability, while fluctuating or decreasing ratios may suggest volatility or challenges in the business.

news.headline: Collegium Announces $25 Million Accelerated Share Repurchase Program
news.summary: STOUGHTON, Mass., Nov. 09, 2023 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- Collegium Pharmaceutical, Inc. (Nasdaq: COLL), a leading, diversified specialty pharmaceutical company committed to improving the lives of people living with serious medical conditions, today announced that it has entered into an Accelerated Share Repurchase ("ASR") agreement with Jefferies LLC to repurchase $25 million of the Company’s common stock. Collegium will execute the ASR as part of the $100 million share repurchase program authorized

news.headline: Collegium Reports Third Quarter 2023 Financial Results
news.summary: – Q3’23 Net Revenue of $136.7 Million, Up 8% Year-over-Year – – Q3’23 GAAP Net Income of $20.6 Million vs. Q3’22 GAAP Net Income of $0.5 Million – – Record Q3’23 Adjusted EBITDA of $89.4 Million, Up 19% Year-over-Year – – Received Extension of Nucynta® Regulatory Exclusivity through July 2026 – – Board of Directors Authorized $25.0 Million Accelerated Share Repurchase Program – – Updated Full Year 2023 Guidance – – Conference Call Scheduled for Today at 4:30 p.m. ET – STOUGHTON, Mass., Nov. 07,
